SEARCH
Module hanyaeger
Package com.github.hanyaeger.api

Class YaegerGame

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
com.github.hanyaeger.api.YaegerGame
public abstract class YaegerGame extends javafx.application.Application
YaegerGame is the base class that must be extended to create a Yaeger game. After extending this class, two lifecycle methods will become available: setupGame() and setupScenes(). The methods should be used for any further configuration.

The constructor of the extending class should be the default empty constructor. Furthermore, the extending class should have a main-method that should look as follows: 


      public static void main(String[] args) {
          launch(args);
      }

      public static final Size DEFAULT_GAME_DIMENSIONS

    • setupGame

      public abstract void setupGame()
      Use this method to call the methods responsible for setting up the Yaeger Game. The following methods are available:
      • setSize(Size)
      • setGameTitle(String)
      • setBackgroundAudio(String)
      • getBackgroundAudioVolume()

    • setupScenes

      public abstract void setupScenes()
      Use this method to add the instances of YaegerScene that make up the Game. A YaegerScene will usually either be a level, a welcome-screen, an intro-screen or a game-over screen, for instance.

      To create a YaegerScene extend either a StaticScene or a DynamicScene. A StaticScene should be used for simple screens that do not need the Game world Update cycle. If such an cycle is required, extend a DynamicScene.

    • setBackgroundAudio

      protected void setBackgroundAudio(String url)
      Set the background audio file. Currently, only *.mp3 files are supported. The audio file will be looped indefinitely. Since it is part of the YaegerGame, it will continue playing through each YaegerScene.

      If the audio file is specific to each YaegerScene, the method YaegerScene.setBackgroundAudio(String) should be used.

      Set the background image file. The url of the image is relative to the resources/ folder, where all resources should be placed. If the resource is placed in a subfolder of resources/, this folder should be opened explicitly from the module descriptor.

      Parameters:
      url - the name of the audio file, including extension

    • setBackgroundAudioVolume

      protected void setBackgroundAudioVolume(double volume)
      Set the playback volume of the background audio.
      Parameters:
      volume - the volume

    • getBackgroundAudioVolume

      protected double getBackgroundAudioVolume()
      Return the playback volume of the background audio. This is a value between [0, 1.0], where 0 means it is not audible and 1.0 it is played at its original volume level.
      Returns:
      the volume as a double

    • stopBackgroundAudio

      protected void stopBackgroundAudio()
      Stop playing the background audio.

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
